title: Babbage - Life, the universe and everything—we ask the fundamental questions
summary:
This week: what do asteroids and moonwater tell us about life?
FROM PRECIOUS moonwater to a handful of asteroid that could provide clues to the origins of life, recent discoveries in our solar system lead host Alok Jha to investigate fundamental questions about the universe.
Could earthly evolution provide a guide to what life elsewhere might be like?
And what about the end of everything—the death of the universe itself?
Runtime: 27 minListen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify |Google | Stitcher | TuneInPlease subscribe to The Economist for full access to print, digital and audio editions: www.economist.com/podcastoffer
paragraphs: Our podcast on the science and technology making the news. This week: what do asteroids and moonwater tell us about life? Is evolution happening elsewhere? And, how might it all end?

FROM PRECIOUS moonwater to a handful of asteroid that could provide clues to the origins of life, recent discoveries in our solar system lead host Alok Jha to investigate fundamental questions about the universe. How did life on Earth begin? Could earthly evolution provide a guide to what life elsewhere might be like? And what about the end of everything—the death of the universe itself? Runtime: 27 min
Listen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify |Google | Stitcher | TuneIn
Please subscribe to The Economist for full access to print, digital and audio editions: www.economist.com/podcastoffer
